heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 21 September 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (190°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 1.9°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 4211 lux) and cloud levels (up 623 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 9652 lux) and cloud levels (up 1136 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 623.0m lower than yesterday, 1135.5m lower than the past week, 775.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 929m and a high of 2240m, averaging 922.1m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry and less humid conditions and near calm conditions. A few light raindrops may fall, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and overcast conditions will limit sunlight. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (93%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
